abstract: New York City Council passes Criminal Justice Reform Act, package of eight bills aimed at creating civil process for many common low-level infractions; court officials estimate that more than 100,000 cases will be diverted from state's court system to civil system overseen by city agency.
lead_paragraph: The legislation will create a civil process for some of the most common low-level infractions observed by police officers, including public drinking and public urination.

headline.main: New York Council Approves Bills to Divert Minor Offenders From Court System
headline.print_headline: Council Approves Bills to Divert Minor Offenders From the Courts

snippet: The legislation will create a civil process for some of the most common low-level infractions observed by police officers, including public drinking and public urination.
